urls.title: ‘Black carbon’ threat to Arctic as sea routes open up with global heating
urls.description: As climate crisis allows new maritime routes to be used, sooty shipping emissions accelerates ice melt and risk to ecosystems

text:
Yeh another circle of doom
Climate change enabling shipping to exploit and use arctic waters. The emissions then make climate change worse.
We're going to make ourselves extinct at this rate
https://t.co/B3RceMSSY1

"Arctic shipping is not only made possible by the climate crisis, it is adding to it too. More ships mean a rise in exhaust fumes, which is accelerating ice melt in this sensitive region due to a complex phenomenon involving “black carbon”,"

https://t.co/5MI9QHJqO9
Imagine your trying to get in the mood for the day ahead with Arctic Monkeys and your child switches it up to the fucking shipping forecast on Radio 4 https://t.co/Y23lBZRvnG

urls.title: Two icebreakers are on the way to rescue ice-locked ships on Northern
urls.description: But some of the vessels will have to wait for at least one week before they are released from captivity in the remote Arctic sea-ice.

So it is done! Plenty of work before but it was worth it! 

Congratulations to all involved!

Fascinating piece on Russia’s multi-billion investment to secure #Arctic dominance.

Northern Sea Route (via Russia / Norway) estimated 40% faster than traditional #SuezCanal journey for tankers / shipping. 

Russia aiming to make it accessible year-round by 2030 @EnergyCouncilHQ https://t.co/iuakEtLf4A

It would be more of a surprise if #Russia, with the longest Arctic coastline of any nation and in the face of changing ice, *didn't* invest heavily in the Arctic. Across defence, oil/gas, shipping, fishing etc.

The nature of investment and end results are of global importance. https://t.co/RuPjwD8lT7

urls.title: Protecting Ocean Life on the High Seas
urls.description: The high seas make up about two-thirds of the world’s ocean, covering the vast expanses beyond the jurisdiction of any country. Research has shown that the high seas hold some of the largest reservoirs of biodiversity on Earth, supporting abundant fisheries, providing migratory routes for whales and sharks, and harboring remarkable ecosystems such as deep-water corals and other majestic marine life.

text: 👍👍But on the positive side 😄we’re opening up a shipping ⚓️ route through the Arctic ❄️ that will shave *14 days* or something off the usual route between the places that might need that. 🤪🙂😆😁😁😐 https://t.co/RETbXNBeci
